query.description: A beatmap checksum.

A beatmap ID to lookup.

request.description:
Returns beatmap.

---

### Response format

See [Get Beatmap](#get-beatmap)

query.description: The [GameMode](#gamemode) to get scores for.
An array of matching Mods, or none // TODO.

Returns [BeatmapUserScore](#beatmapuserscore)

The position returned depends on the requested mode and mods.

query.description: The [GameMode](#gamemode) to get scores for.
An array of matching Mods, or none // TODO.
Beatmap score ranking type // TODO.

request.description:
Returns the top scores for a beatmap

Returns [BeatmapScores](#beatmapscores)

Gets beatmap data for the specified beatmap ID.

---

### Response format

Returns [Beatmap](#beatmap) object.
Following attributes are included in the response object when applicable,

Attribute                            | Notes
-------------------------------------|------
beatmapset                           | Includes ratings property.
failtimes                            | |
max_combo                            | |

This endpoint allows you to create a new PM channel.

---

### Response Format

Field            | Type
---------------- | -----------------
new_channel_id   | `channel_id` of newly created [ChatChannel](#chatchannel)
presence         | array of [ChatChannel](#chatchannel)
message          | the sent [ChatMessage](#chatmessage)

<aside class="notice">
  This endpoint will only allow the creation of PMs initially, group chat support will come later.
</aside>

query.description: The `message_id` of the last message to retrieve messages since
If provided, will only return messages for the given channel
number of messages to return (max of 50)

request.description:
This endpoint returns new messages since the given `message_id` along with updated channel 'presence' data.

---

### Response Format

Field            | Type
---------------- | -----------------
presence         | array of [ChatChannel](#chatchannel)
messages         | array of [ChatMessage](#chatmessage)

<aside class="notice">
  Note that this returns messages for all channels the user has joined.
</aside>

query.description: number of messages to return (max of 50)
messages after the specified message id will be returned
messages up to but not including the specified message id will be returned

request.description:
This endpoint returns the chat messages for a specific channel.

---

### Response Format

Returns an array of [ChatMessage](#chatmessage)

query.description: The `channel_id` of the channel to send message to

request.description:
This endpoint returns the chat messages for a specific channel. --- ### Response Format The sent [ChatMessage](#chatmessage)
When sending a message, the last_read_id for the ChatChannel is also updated to mark the new message as read.

This endpoint allows you to join a public channel.

---

### Response Format

Returns the joined [ChatChannel](#chatchannel).

<aside class="notice">
  This endpoint will only allow the joining of public channels initially.
</aside>

This endpoint allows you to leave a public channel.

---

### Response Format

_empty response_

<aside class="notice">
  This endpoint will only allow the leaving of public channels initially.
</aside>

query.description: The `channel_id` of the channel to mark as read
The `message_id` of the message to mark as read up to

request.description:
This endpoint marks the channel as having being read up to the given `message_id`. --- ### Response Format _empty response_
Note that the read marker cannot be moved backwards - i.e. if a channel has been marked as read up to message_id = 12, you cannot then set it backwards to message_id = 10. It will be rejected.

This endpoint returns a list of all joinable public channels.

---

### Response Format

Returns an array of [ChatChannel](#chatchannel)

This endpoint creates a new channel if doesn't exist and joins it.
Currently only for rejoining existing PM channels which the user has left.

---

### Response Format

Returns [ChatChannel](#chatchannel) with `recent_messages` attribute.
Note that if there's no existing PM channel, most of the fields will be blank.
In that case, [send a message](#create-new-pm) instead to create the channel.

query.description: The type of resource to get comments for.
The id of the resource to get comments for.
Pagination option. See [CommentSort](#commentsort) for detail. The format follows [Cursor](#cursor) except it's not currently included in the response.
Limit to comments which are reply to the specified id. Specify 0 to get top level comments.
Sort option as defined in [CommentSort](#commentsort). Defaults to `new` for guests and user-specified default when authenticated.

request.description:
Returns a list comments and their replies up to 2 levels deep.

---

### Response Format

Returns [CommentBundle](#commentbundle).

`pinned_comments` is only included when `commentable_type` and `commentable_id` are specified.

query.description: Resource ID the comment thread is attached to
Resource type the comment thread is attached to
Text of the comment
The id of the comment to reply to, null if not a reply

request.description:
Posts a new comment to a comment thread.

---

### Response Format

Returns [CommentBundle](#commentbundle)

Gets a comment and its replies up to 2 levels deep.

---

### Response Format

Returns [CommentBundle](#commentbundle)

query.description: New text of the comment

request.description:
Edit an existing comment.

---

### Response Format

Returns [CommentBundle](#commentbundle)

Deletes the specified comment.

---

### Response Format

Returns [CommentBundle](#commentbundle)

Upvotes a comment.

---

### Response Format

Returns [CommentBundle](#commentbundle)

Un-upvotes a comment.

---

### Response Format

Returns [CommentBundle](#commentbundle)

query.description: [Cursor](#cursor) for pagination.
Post sorting option. Valid values are `id_asc` (default) and `id_desc`.
Maximum number of posts to be returned (20 default, 50 at most).
First post id to be returned with `sort` set to `id_asc`. This parameter is ignored if `cursor` is specified.
First post id to be returned with `sort` set to `id_desc`. This parameter is ignored if `cursor` is specified.

request.description:
Get topic and its posts.

---

### Response Format

Field  | Type                       | Notes
------ | -------------------------- | -----
cursor | [Cursor](#cursor)          | |
search |                            | Parameters used for current request excluding cursor.
posts  | [ForumPost](#forum-post)[] | Includes `body`.
topic  | [ForumTopic](#forum-topic) | |

query.description: Either `all`, `user`, or `wiki_page`. Default is `all`.
Search keyword.
Search result page. Ignored for mode `all`.

request.description:
Searches users and wiki pages.

---

### Response Format

Field     | Type                          | Description
--------- | ----------------------------- | -----------
user      | SearchResult<UserCompact>? | For `all` or `user` mode. Only first 100 results are accessible
wiki_page | SearchResult<WikiPage>?    | For `all` or `wiki_page` mode

#### SearchResult<T>

Field | Type   | Description
----- | ------ | -----------
data  | T[]    | |
total | number | |

item.name: Multiplayer
item.description:
Returns detail of highest score of specified user and the surrounding scores.

---

### Response Format

Returns [MultiplayerScore](#multiplayerscore) object.

query.description: Number of scores to be returned.
[MultiplayerScoresSort](#multiplayerscoressort) parameter.
[MultiplayerScoresCursor](#multiplayerscorescursor) parameter.
Maximum `id` fetched. Can be used to load earlier notifications. Defaults to no limit (fetch latest notifications)

request.description:
This endpoint returns a list of the user's unread notifications. Sorted descending by `id` with limit of 50.

---

### Response Format

Returns an object containing [Notification](#notification) and other related attributes.

Field                 | Type
--------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------
has_more              | boolean whether or not there are more notifications
notifications         | array of [Notification](#notification)
unread_count          | total unread notifications
notification_endpoint | url to connect to websocket server

This endpoint allows you to mark notifications read.

---

### Response Format

_empty response_
Revokes currently authenticated token.

query.description: Filter ranking by country code. Only available for `type` of `performance`.
[Cursor](#cursor).
Either `all` (default) or `friends`.
The id of the spotlight if `type` is `charts`. Ranking for latest spotlight will be returned if not specified.
Filter ranking to specified mode variant. For `mode` of `mania`, it's either `4k` or `7k`. Only available for `type` of `performance`.

request.description:
Gets the current ranking for the specified type and game mode.

---

### Response Format

Returns [Rankings](#rankings)

Gets the list of spotlights.

---

### Response Format

Returns [Spotlights](#spotlights)

Similar to [Get User](#get-user) but with authenticated user (token owner) as user id.

---

### Response format

See [Get User](#get-user).

query.description: Maximum number of results.
Result offset for pagination.

request.description:
Returns kudosu history.

---

### Response format

Array of [KudosuHistory](#kudosuhistory).

query.description: Only for recent scores, include scores of failed plays. Set to 1 to include them. Defaults to 0.
[GameMode](#gamemode) of the scores to be returned. Defaults to the specified `user`'s mode.
Maximum number of results.
Result offset for pagination.

variable.description: Score type. Must be one of these: `best`, `firsts`, `recent`.

request.description:
This endpoint returns the scores of specified user.

Array of [Score](#score).
Following attributes are included in the response object when applicable.

Attribute  | Notes
-----------|----------------------
beatmap    | |
beatmapset | |
weight     | Only for type `best`.
user       | |

query.description: Maximum number of results.
Result offset for pagination.

Result offset for pagination.

request.description:
Returns recent activity.

Array of [Event](#event).

This endpoint returns the detail of specified user.

---

### Response format

Returns [User](#user) object.
Following attributes are included in the response object when applicable.

Attribute                            | Notes
-------------------------------------|------
account_history                      | |
active_tournament_banner             | |
badges                               | |
beatmap_playcounts_count             | |
favourite_beatmapset_count           | |
follower_count                       | |
graveyard_beatmapset_count           | |
groups                               | |
loved_beatmapset_count               | |
monthly_playcounts                   | |
page                                 | |
previous_usernames                   | |
rank_history                         | For specified mode.
ranked_and_approved_beatmapset_count | |
replays_watched_counts               | |
scores_best_count                    | For specified mode.
scores_first_count                   | For specified mode.
scores_recent_count                  | For specified mode.
statistics                           | For specified mode. Inluces `rank` and `variants` attributes.
support_level                        | |
unranked_beatmapset_count            | |
user_achievements                    | |

query.description: User id to be returned. Specify once for each user id requested. Up to 50 users can be requested at once.

request.description:
Returns list of users.

Field | Type                          | Description
----- | ----------------------------- | -----------
users | [UserCompact](#usercompact)[] | Includes: country, cover, groups, statistics_fruits, statistics_mania, statistics_osu, statistics_taiko.

The wiki article or image data.
